basics.name: Kye Steele
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025. I am pursuing software development and cybersecurity as career paths.

courses: Discrete Math for Computer Science I (ICS 141)
Discrete Math for Computer Science II (ICS 241)

highlights: Redesign the company's current role-based access controls system such that it adheres to the principle of least privilege
Provide a quality of work-life improvement for every employee within DRC, and improve the company's overall security with this RBAC redesign
Interview a multitude of employees to gain an understanding of everyone's role in the company, and how they take care of their respective responsibilites
Configure diagnostics settings within the Azure platform such that all cloud-based company resource activity is being logged
Conduct research on SOC II vendors to find a solution best suited to aid DRC in reaching SOC II compliance
Conducted a research project on the optimization of current malware analysis techniques and protocols
Presented my findings and made suggestions for improvement of current techniques and protocols to NIWC, UH faculty, and local politicians
Maui in Moana Jr, Sebastian in The Little Mermaid, Link Larkin in Hairspray
Performed in a large cast of a large age range
Earned rank of black belt in 2018
Led weekly one-hour trainings at dojo
Eagle Scout project (sneeze guards for students), 2021
Community service involvement throughout: line painting at Saint Ann's Church, He'eia Estuary cleanup, Haiku stream cleanup, Baskets of Blessings, speech festival

awards.title: Provost Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to entering high school graduates to recognize outstanding academic performance.

awards.title: Eagle Scout Rank
awards.summary: After nine years in scouting, I earned the rank of eagle scout.

awards.title: First Dan Black Belt
awards.summary: After eight years of training, I was promoted to black belt in Shotokan Karate.
